overview:
Alice R. Resnick Vice President, Corporate and Marketing Communications

Alice Resnick joined SRI in 1996 and became Vice President of Corporate and Marketing Communications in 2004. She leads the development and implementation of strategic communications programs in the areas of branding, public relations, marketing communications, community relations, and staff communications.

Resnick has 35 years of experience in communications and publishing. Before joining SRI, she was corporate communications and investor relations manager for Catalytica, a technology company serving the chemical, energy, and pharmaceutical industries. She was also manager of the firm’s publications team, which produced multiclient studies for the chemical industry. Prior to Catalytica, she was an editor at Acurex Corporation, where she produced reports and proposals for energy, environmental science, and aerospace government and business clients. Her career began in the editorial department of R. R. Bowker Publishing Co. and in the advertising department of The New Yorker magazine.

From 1994-1995, Resnick was Vice President of Programs for the Silicon Valley Chapter of the National Investor Relations Institute. Her work has been recognized with awards from PR News and Financial World, and with five awards from the Society for Technical Communication. Resnick attended Hunter College of the City University of New York and has a certificate in marketing communications from San Jose State University.
